Sympathy for the devil? More like some objective observations here. 

The locked toilet door is not unusual. Most people do this I surmise, as a 
rule of thumb. The fact she called out and he didn't hear it was claimed to 
be due to his ears being temporarily deafened by the first shot. 

What is unusual is his assumption that she was in the bed. Tests revealed 
that it was pitch black so he couldn't have seen her anyway.

How would he be so negligent unless he was on some cocktail of drugs for 
his shoulder? Time and response is affected by many chemicals. I feel the 
time the entire event occurred, if we believe his story, is not a few 
minutes but seconds & so it's entirely possible he simply assumed she was 
in bed. This happens. In a scientific test I'm sure it would happen several 
times over a number of reaction tests. Speaking to her 10 seconds ago might 
have appeared to his medicated mind to be only 2 seconds ago.

Right now though I think what happened involves her saying she was stepping 
out for an hour or so to see a girlfriend or for some other reason, even 
her attempt to quieten down the general rowdiness of the night. OP may have 
raised his voice a few times. CCTV shows no-one leaving OP's house so maybe 
she went downstairs and made a sandwich or the toilet downstairs, (?) to 
text her Valentines.

This scenario might mean he is guilty of perjury since his story does not

draw attention to the police having been called two hours earlier to the 
house because of a commotion. He cut too fine though not mentioning it at 
all.

Her leaving  and what she may have said may have convinced his edgy brain 
that she was definitely not in the house at the time. I suspect he would 
need to have a clear belief or assumption she was not in the house.A little
